unicode.value: Separation of mixture of sand and ammonium chloride

An activity can be defined as a task or set of tasks a learner must complete. Provide a clear statement of the task and consider any conditions that may help or hinder the learner in the performance of the task.
Describe the tasks the learners should complete.

1. To make pupil understand that mixtures can easily be separated by physical methods.

2. To acquaint the children about heterogeneous nature of mixtures.

3. To make the students understand about simple physical process sublimation to separate sublime from non sublime substance..
University of Auckland

An activity can be defined as a task or set of tasks a learner must complete. Provide a clear statement of the task and consider any conditions that may help or hinder the learner in the performance of the task.
Describe the tasks the learners should complete.

Sand and ammonium chloride form a heterogeneous mixture and can be separated easily by physical methods of separation. By selecting the right order of methods of separation, the two can be easily separated:
(i) ammonium chloride sublimes on heating;
(ii) sand is left being non volatile.

SCORM Quiz
University of Auckland

Unlike the MCQ the SCORM quiz is used to test the learners knowledge on a topic without providing the learner with feedback to the correct answer. The quiz will often be given once the learner has had time to learn and practice using the information or skill.
Enter the question stem. The quest should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.
How can you separate a mixture of sand , common salt and ammonium chloride. what should be the correct sequence of the procesess?
